entry.title: Combined summary - Ubuntu LTS Packaging?
entry.summary: On April 12, 2014, Oliver Egginger sent an email to the Bitcoin-development mailing list enquiring about timely updates for critical vulnerabilities. He mentioned developing a LiveCD for hot/cold wallet management on Ubuntu LTS basis and his decision to maintain his own repository for this project. He also asked for better alternatives if any. In response to this email, Matt confirmed that there was nothing new yet and informed that version 0.9.1 did not change anything for dynamically-linked-to-openssl builds. The email thread also contained a link to Jenkins Continuous Integration for developers to try out.Oliver is developing a LiveCD for hot/cold wallet management based on Ubuntu LTS. He is looking for timely updates to address critical vulnerabilities. To do this, he has decided to maintain his own repository for the project. Oliver has shared a link to his project on Launchpad and is open to suggestions for better alternatives.In an email exchange on April 12, 2014 at 2:26:07 PM, Oliver Egginger inquired about updates regarding a LiveCD for hot/cold wallet management on Ubuntu LTS basis. He provided a link to the Bitcoin Launchpad page and mentioned that he decided to maintain his own repository for the project due to the need for timely updates, particularly for critical vulnerabilities. However, Luke clarified that the mailing list is for development purposes only and suggested that the latest relevant version for packaging is 0.9.0, which can be found in the PPA that Oliver linked.Oliver also reached out to Matt Corallo on April 12th, 2014 at 5:34 PM regarding an issue with his dynamically-linked-to-openssl builds. Matt responded by stating that the version of 0.9.1 was up to date and did not change anything for these builds. Oliver apologized for the trouble and expressed gratitude for Matt's assistance.Oliver Egginger inquired about any updates regarding Bitcoin on April 12, 2014 and shared a link to the official website of Bitcoin. Wladimir replied that the only alteration in version 0.9.1 was OpenSSL's dependency version used in the binary gitian builds. However, the PPA build is reliant on the operating system OpenSSL, so upgrading it should suffice.
